channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Renewed Attacks on Powell Drive Markets Lower and Weaken Dollar
item.description: President Trump’s pressure on the Federal Reserve, on top of the uncertainty about his tariff policy, continued to jar investors as stocks, bonds, oil...

item.title: How Pope Francis Catalyzed the Catholic Right in the U.S.
item.description: His critics were fellow clergy as well as elected officials in the ascendant wing of the American Catholic political realm.

item.title: Even fellow critics of the Federal Reserve want Trump to back off Powell as stocks and the dollar both slide
item.description: When politics interferes with the central bank’s ability to set monetary policy, inflation tends to be the result.

item.title: U.S. Asks Judge to Break Up Google
item.description: The Justice Department said the best way to address the company’s monopoly in internet search was to force it to sell Chrome, among other measures.

item.title: RFK Jr. Plans to Phase Out 8 Commonly Used Food Dyes
item.description: The petroleum-based dyes are used in hundreds of thousands of items including cereals and sports drinks. The health secretary is expected to release m...

item.title: Ray Dalio fears ‘something worse than a recession.’ If anything his fears are understated
item.description: The world faces a host of economic and political perils—and the key to resolving them is missing.

item.title: South Carolina senators are trying to give their state treasurer the boot over a $1.8 billion accounting error
item.description: “He's a liar that was so concerned with his public appearance that he would do and say anything to cover up his mistake,” Sen. Stephen Goldfinch said ...

item.title: Trump and Pope Francis Had Sharply Different Views, and Sharp Disagreements
item.description: The pope and the president remade the Catholic church and American politics in their outsider images, but their relationship was defined by their rema...

item.title: ‘Will we abandon the search market and surrender them to control of the monopolists?’ The Justice Department says Google’s ‘illegal conduct has created an economic goliath’
item.description: "Gen AI is Google's next evolution to keep their vicious cycle spinning," the DOJ's lawyer said.

item.title: Bitcoin rebounds as the U.S. dollar weakens and Trump feuds with Fed Chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Bitcoin touches $87,000 as Trump’s feud with the Federal Reserve triggers economic uncertainty.

item.title: Who Will Be the Next Pope? Here Are Some Possible Candidates to Succeed Francis.

item.title: Romans Mourn Francis, Their Bishop and Their ‘Man of Peace’
item.description: The faithful converged on Francis’ other spiritual home, St. John Lateran, to pay their respects and process the passing of their diocesan leader.

item.title: Francis, the First Latin American Pope, Dies at 88
